author: IGN
description:
Check out the Street Fighter Ken Masters Gameplay Reveal Trailer for Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves, the latest action fighting game installment in the Fatal Fury franchise developed by SNK. Players can take to the stage and fight as the legendary Ken Masters of Street Fighter fame. Players can use Ken Masters in Arcade Mode, depicting the first meeting between Ken and Terry, serving as a prologue to their upcoming battles alongside his inclusion in EOST Mode, where he will unravel the plot of a shadowy figure who has begun to warp the people of South Town. Ken Masters is launching in Summer 2025 for PlayStation 4 (PS4), PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X|S, and PC (Steam and Epic Games Store).

#FatalFuryCityoftheWolvesxStreetFighter  #IGN  #Gaming
title: Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves x Street Fighter - Official Ken Masters Gameplay Reveal Trailer

author: IGN
title: Did you recognize his voice in Superman?

author: IGN
description:
Don't miss the 'Super Powers' Trailer for The Fantastic Four: First Steps, the latest installment in the MCU distributed by Marvel Studios. The Fantastic Four: First Steps is in theaters on July 25.
The Fantastic Four: First Steps stars Pedro Pascal, Vanessa Kirby, Joseph Quinn, Ebon Moss-Bachrach, Ralph Ineson, and Julia Garner. The Fantastic Four: First Steps opens in theaters on July 25, 2025.
Set against the vibrant backdrop of a 1960s-inspired, retro- futuristic world, Marvel Studios’ The Fantastic Four: First Steps introduces Marvel’s First Family—Reed Richards/Mister Fantastic (Pedro Pascal), Sue Storm/Invisible Woman (Vanessa Kirby), Johnny Storm/Human Torch (Joseph Quinn) and Ben Grimm/The Thing (Ebon Moss-Bachrach) as they face their most daunting challenge yet. Forced to balance their roles as heroes with the strength of their family bond, they must defend Earth from a ravenous space god called Galactus (Ralph Ineson) and his enigmatic Herald, Silver Surfer (Julia Garner).
title: The Fantastic Four: First Steps - Official 'Super Powers' Trailer

author: IGN
title: Superman's Rick Flagg Sr. on his hair color difference

author: IGN
description: Zack Snyder has graciously passed the torch to James Gunn and Henry Cavill has happily handed over his cape to David Corenswet, and yet somehow the social media civil war over Superman continues to rage: What kind of Superman fan are you? It might be a minefield we're stepping into, but it's time to look at the evidence and make the case for and against each director. It's Snyder vs Gunn in the great debate of our Super-times.
title: Snyder vs. Gunn: Who Did Superman Best?

author: IGN
description:
FULL SPOILERS AHEAD! James Gunn’s Superman has officially flown into theaters, bringing with it characters like David Corenswet’s Superman/Clark Kent, Rachel Brosnahan’s Lois Lane, and Nicholas Hoult’s Lex Luthor. But a surprise character joined the fold, surprising DC fans everywhere. 

That’s right, the wait to meet Milly Alcock’s Supergirl is over. The Girl of Steel has crash landed in the DCU in all of her drunken glory. But why is this version of the character so much different from classic characterizations of Kara Danvers? The answer to that question sits with the limited run comic Supergirl: Woman of Tomorrow. Join us as we break down what her comic history tells us about the Girl of Steel’s future in the DC Studios franchise, and what that future means for the character and women in the DCU as a whole.

#IGN #Superman #DC
title: What The Surprise Character Who Called Superman A B!tch Means To The Future of James Gunn's DCU

author: IGN
description:
You beat Death Stranding 2… now what? Is there New Game Plus? Can you keep exploring after the story ends? Are there secret preppers, unlockables, or a big platinum grind waiting for you? In this video, Mark Medina from IGN’s video guides team breaks down everything Death Stranding 2 has to offer after the credits roll – all without spoiling the major story twists.

From post-game world changes to hidden characters like Mr. Impossible and BPAS, we’ll show you what unlocks after Episode 16, how the optional Drawbridge Q-pid toggle affects gameplay, and what it takes to hit full completion. We’ll also walk you through the platinum trophy grind – including tips on building roads, mining materials, and making the most of your time in Australia and Mexico.

00:00 - Intro  
00:37 - Is There New Game Plus?  
00:56 - Can You Play After the Credits?  
01:37 - Is There a World-State Change?  
02:57 - Post-Game Activities Explained  
04:01 - How to Unlock Mr. Impossible  
05:23 - How to Unlock B
title: Death Stranding 2 Post-Game Guide: Endgame, NG+, and World Changes

author: IGN
description:
Don't expect miracles from Of Ash and Steel, but the preview was evidence of a promising mid-tier RPG that'll likely enthuse ye olde genre purists while still being accessible and interesting enough to draw in lovers of more modern character-driven action. Watch the video for our detailed hands-on impressions. Previewed by Jon Bolding

#IGN #Gaming
title: Of Ash and Steel Is a Charmingly Old-School Fantasy Adventure

author: IGN
description:
Grand Theft Auto 6 is fast approaching, and it looks like it's going to change the series forever. But there are some vital lessons it can learn from arguably Rockstar's biggest ever risk with the Grand Theft Auto games.

GTA 4's success was never guaranteed. Grand Theft Auto 4 was a major departure from the cartoon worlds for GTA 3, Vice City and GTA San Andreas. It was mature, had muted colours and opted for more realistic driving and dour tones. It was an enormous risk for Rockstar to completely change their beloved series, but it paid off in a big way.

So, what can GTA 6 learn from GTA 4? In this video, we delve into everything great and risky about Grand Theft Auto 4, and what 2026's Grand Theft Auto 6 can draw inspiration from to ensure it also forges its own unique identity in the long-running Grand Theft Auto series.
 
This GTA 4 review retrospective celebrates Rockstar's best game.


Subscribe to IGN for more!
http://www.youtube.com/user/IGNentertainment?sub_confirmation=1
title: What GTA 6 Can Learn From GTA 4, AKA The Best GTA Game

author: IGN
description:
Mecha Break reviewed by Will Borger on PC, also available on Xbox Series X|S.

Mecha Break’s strategic, twitchy gameplay has its hooks in me, the 15 flavors of mech all feel great to pilot, and I dig the maps in Operation Verge and Ace Arena. I’m not over the moon about Operation Storm and I think the monetization is simultaneously fine in some places and potentially predatory in others. But I’m here for the 6v6 and 3v3 modes. That stuff is for PvP sickos. I’ve come away liking the little moments, the stories my group has been a part of. If Mecha Break plays it smart, I think it has the juice to last for the long haul, and I know my crew will be hitting me up for matches for the foreseeable future. We’re still chasing those moments of perfection, those stories. Sometimes we’ll get there. Sometimes we won’t. But the perfect match is out there. And I’ll be damned if I’m not gonna try to find it.

#IGN #Gaming
title: Mecha Break Review

title: Ghost of Yotei solves an AC Shadows problem
